resources.string: Once the registration period ends, the system performs a random selection process (the lottery) to choose the required number of participants from the Waiting List. All participants who are selected receive an invitation notification.

Selected entrants have a limited time to accept the invitation (Sign Up). If a selected spot is declined or expires, the system automatically draws a replacement from the remaining Waiting List entrants to maintain fairness and fill the event capacity.

The lottery system ensures fair access for all users, eliminating the need to rush or repeatedly refresh a webpage to secure a spot. This is particularly beneficial for users with scheduling limitations or disabilities, as it provides an equal chance to register as long as they join the Waiting List before the deadline.

FairChance provides organizers with tools to set capacity limits, define registration windows, and automatically manage the attendee selection and replacement process. This streamlines event management and ensures full attendance.

Organizers can monitor the waiting list, view attendance data, and send targeted notifications to all entrants, selected participants, or those who were not chosen, providing full communication control.
